item.title: Maritime DDR Sensor — Material-Discriminating LiDAR for Search and Rescue
item.description: Designed a polarization-based LiDAR sensor architecture that automatically distinguishes life-saving equipment from ocean debris during maritime search and rescue operations, achieving >30 dB discrimination at projected production costs of $600–800 per unit — a 75–300x reduction versus conventional systems. Patent pending.
